Message.Msg: Jeepers Best, NOBODY tees-up the ball as high as ashraf. When his do-it-yourself securities analysis gig ends, -- which looks like it could be Really soon -- maybe he could try his hand at becoming a caddie? I just guessing here, but with a name like that, I'll bet he's good with the Sand traps too.

Now now now, boys. Be kind to squire ashraf.eassa. I like the guy. Seriously. Now granted, his lame, unschooled attempt at securities analysis is laughable -- but the engineering student has found a way to pay the rent, right? That shows creativity and drive. As you may know Best's first job out of school was that of a Real securities analyst. So here's a few of pointers. 1. Don't go into securities analysis. Unless of course, you Like endless chicken and peas luncheons, and four airports, four planes and four limos per week. 2. So your piece hyping the merits of nvidia Bombed the very next day, right?. When the stock Plunged like (-5%) immediately After your piece came out. Do not -- I repeat Do Not -- write the following day "What the Heck Happened?" It lacks, well, conviction in your own opinion. 3. Give your readers New and Original research. Not a badly slanted re-hashing of what they already know. Like ibbey does. Read the weekly JP Morgan newsletter for High Net Worth Clients to see how the best-of-the-best do it. 4. Finally, skip the securities analysis business completely -- and go into the cutting edge of semiconductor engineering -- research into human brain processing. You know. Like QUALCOMM's Chairman Paul Jacob's kid is doing. Good luck and all the Best to you. Seriously.

Message.Title: More Babble from Ashraf
Message.Msg: about Arm today...tomorrow who knows....anything for those clicks..LOL

Topic.Title: "AMD accuses former staff of giving 100,000 secret documents to NVIDIA"

Message.Msg: It's been five (5) days since The Corporate Espionage News of the Year broke. Any new news in the Secretgate scandal? Like where AMD's 100,000 secret documents are? Or where the alleged perps are? Or if the Nvidia Board has a decent succession plan ready to go? So many many questions here.
I would say that my "babble" is a fair bit more useful than your posts on a Yahoo! Message Board.

best.here I genuinely enjoy some of the posts that you make, and not just because I find the sarcasm and the wit amusing -- you bring up good points on the more negative side of Nvidia. But what has me very interested is why you seem to completely ignore any positives surrounding the company. For example, as someone who is a Best-Of-The-Best securities analyst, surely you know that the company is doing quite well in the high margin segments of the market (discrete GPU, HPC accelerators, workstation graphics). While workstation graphics seems to not be doing so well in the near term, do you not envision an uptick in demand when the cards in the series are refreshed? Further, if you paid attention to past conference calls, like a best-of-the-best securities analyst, you would know that Tegra SoCs are actually higher margin than GPUs on average. This means that once Nvidia can ramp the Tegras to the right revenue level, it will be quite positive for the top AND bottom lines. I realize you think poorly of Jen Hsun Huang as a CEO, but do you honestly mean to tell me that this company really doesn't have the growth potential that the longs do? Thanks.

Message.Title: Best -- Who Are You?
Message.Msg: I ask this with sincerity. Who are you? What hedge fund do you work for? I wonder because it doesn't seem to make sense that someone would be paying you to post your bearish ideas/bashing on a Yahoo! Message Board, where the influence is likely to be very minimal on the share price. So, best, who are you? What is your purpose on these boards? Or is this just your hobby?

Could Best be a generic tag used by a bunch of folks from the same department in a company to flame the competition? If that can be proven it would be great to see them and their company tyaken to the cleaners for defamation-slander etc

I'll tell who he is, he's a bitter, mentally & socially challenged misfit who's still trying to get back at his parents for abandoning him at a Stucky's on the interstate when he was a young lad. Having 50+ aliases is a method of trying to get attention that he didn't get growing up in a van down by the river, and being raised by a bunch of bag ladies.

You know Bestie, the worst and I mean WORST thing an investor can do is be too emotional. From your MANY MANY posts it is clear you have become well too emotional. A few here have posted that Bestie lost a boat load on RMBS and now spends his days posting his creepy myriad sock puppet posts here and a few other places in order to soothe his wrecked ego. If you continue to not answer this question head-on then many will just keep putting you on ignore and that certainly does not help your 'cause' eh? A few like he and I will give you a chance because you amuse us, you know like a clown, but if you donâ€™t give up the real story now, you will lose us tooâ€¦ then it will be just you reading you-- a sordid boon. And clearly not what you want or 'need.' I look forward to your reply.
To me he sounds like Gollum, talking about the precious ring that he lost.

Topic.Title: On the eve of Apple's earnings cc on Wednesday....

Message.Msg: I have no position in Apple, but I certainly would like to see their Mac division thrive for obvious reasons (Nvidia GPUs). I don't expect the iPad/iPhone high margin rush to continue much longer, though. AAPL will eventually be priced more like a Lenovo and less like an Exxon Mobil.

Topic.Title: On the eve of Apple's earnings cc on Wednesday....

Message.Msg: Agree with you, ibexx88. Qualcomm is definitely a better place to be than Apple, and I think there's more room to run on that stock. However, I like Nvidia better simply because of the much richer upside potential that it has. Once Nvidia has i500 out and once Grey is shipping en masse, I see no reason why it can't very significantly steal a big chunk of Qualcomm's smartphone share.

Message.Msg: Can't disagree with any of them... MS had that ridiculous decision to limit partnerships...

I heard a rumor about some annoying person that matches Bestthepest's description living in a van on the shore of the Chicago Sanitary and Ship Canal in the Joliet area. It appears that Besty loiters at the public library after his usual morning dumpster diving routine. They can tell when he's in the building by the rancid smell of raw sewage. Why I think it's him is that he has over 50 library cards in various names.

Topic.Title: Microsoft's ARM blunder: 7 reasons why Windows RT was DOA

Message.Msg: I actually messed with a Surface at Staples and found that the keyboard had a very nice touch and feel to it, and it had a very low-profile and nice look. MSFT has always had a terrible marketing strategy, bad commercials, and an ignorance of competitively pricing a product that needs to take in consideration the overall market, and a failure to establish any kind of momentum sales. It's a safe bet that if this was an Apple product we would be seeing the media in full hype mode showing long lines waiting overnight in line. They just should have done the same thing as they did with X box? Perhaps if Gates was still around, and not Ballmer?
